feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued September 18 at 8:37AM AKDT until September 18 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON ALONG THE LOWER KUSKOKWIM RIVER... * WHAT...Flooding caused by storm surge is expected. * WHERE...The lower Kuskokwim River, including Bethel, Napakiak, and other nearby villages. * WHEN...Until 345 PM AKDT Sunday.

entry.summary: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING FOR AREAS NORTH OF TOKSOOK BAY... * LOCATION...The Kuskokwim Delta coast north of Toksook Bay. * COASTAL FLOODING...Water levels are expected to rise up to 4 feet above the normal highest tide line. * TIMING...Through 10 AM AKDT Sunday morning.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 2:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rain and Rising River Levels This Weekend... Moderate to heavy rainfall will continue to fall over the Seward Peninsula and western Brooks Range, as the remnants of post- tropical typhoon Merbok track northeastward through the Bering Strait and Chukchi Sea. Expect three-day rainfall totals around 3 inches at Red Dog Mine, around 5 inches in the peaks of the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.summary: ...Lingering Smoke Today, Cooler and Wetter through Wednesday... * Smoke impacts from the Mosquito Fire today are anticipated to be similar to what was experienced Saturday. The densest smoke will be directed into the Sierra Valley-Portola areas, arching east across Pyramid Lake and into west central Nevada overnight into Monday morning. entry.title: Flood Warning issued September 18 at 9:53AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1000 AM EDT.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued September 18 at 11:31AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Another round of strong to severe thunderstorms is expected late this afternoon and evening over southeast Iowa. Yesterday between 4 and 5 inches fell over much of of southern and southeast Iowa. Though not a certainty, some areas may receive another 2 to 3 inches of rainfall which could lead to flooding in poor drainage urban areas or low-lying areas.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 2:19AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty south winds expected through Tuesday... A slow moving and strong low pressure system off of the northern California coast will bring gusty south winds to much of Nevada today as well as Monday and Tuesday. entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PDT MONDAY... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Quality Advisory...in effect until 3 PM PDT Monday. entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued September 18 at 2:51AM MDT until September 19 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Unseasonably warm temperatures are expected Monday. With very dry air in place, minimum relative humidity will drop below 15 percent for portions of northeast Wyoming and southwest South Dakota and range from 15 to 22 percent for the remainder of western South Dakota. Wind gusts of 20 to 30 mph are possible for portions of northeast Wyoming and southwest South Dakota Monday

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 9:59AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today for portions of the Coastal Bend and portions of the western Brush Country. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored
